comments:
Platform is Ubuntu 7.04 with 
gcc 4.1.2
gdb 6.6

Eclipse  3.3.1.1 with ALL Europa projects

This error happens during debugging. It happens every time I click "display as array" on a pointer (which in fact points to an array) which is inside global struct variable or on a pointer which is pointed to by a pointer-to-pointer global variable. 
For example if I have the code :

#include <stdlib.h>

int** arr;

int main(int argc, char** argv) {
	arr = (int**) malloc(2 * sizeof(int*));
	arr[0] = (int*) malloc(3 * sizeof(int));
	arr[1] = (int*) malloc(3 * sizeof(int));

	return 0;
}

when I click "display as array"  on *arr (which is an int*) I get a dialog window stating that multiple errors have occurred.
Following is the part of the error log describing the tree errors that occur in succession:

The CLocalVariable is trying to get a stack frame however the parent of the variable is the target, there is no stack frame for global variables. It looks like something missed when we added global variable support which was quite a while ago.

I downloaded Wascana 0.9.3, and I tried this on my Windows XP SP2. And it works there!!
Perhaps this is related to the version of Eclipse/CDT ... or the OS and toolchain ...
